revised_title: Carbonic Acid Excretion in Living Plants
tldr: The author discovered that living plants excrete carbonic acid, not only in their normal condition but also when deprived of oxygen. This evolution is connected to the life of the plant and is due to two causes: previous oxidation and the separation of carbonic acid from the plant's proximate principles during growth.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
